text: Has anyone else have a problem with HubDB when updating it on the DB end not showing the results on the page? in my case I am adding another value on a multi select dropdown row and although the entry is added, on the page is not showing.
Can you send me a link?

I know I've said this before, but having a form based entry solution for editing or adding HubDB entries would be very beneficial. Similar to how with an access database you can create a form so users who are not familiar with DB's can enter info easier.
or like Google Forms feeding a Sheet, absolutely.
yep
Second that - mentioned something similar before in <#C26E7JT8V|ideas> like airtable does it
Idea for CMv2 Module: Fully paginated HubDB listing view with html templates
One other thing that has just annoyed me is this:
Please make this smaller as it overlaps the right arrow
Which browser are you using?
Chrome
Put up an issue, should be an easy fix
Thnx
I'm seeing some weird behavior on the HubDB API. If I create a table via API, I'm not able to update the columns via API. If I create the table in the UI, I can update columns
<@U7QHZR9DZ> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U7QHZR9DZ/FAV71N274/-.txt|Untitled>
"internal error" is a suspicious reply; usually errors on the API are hyper-specific
Ah weird; seems to only happen if you create the table via API without columns:
<@U7QHZR9DZ> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U7QHZR9DZ/FAUG7FV16/-.sh|Untitled>

<@U7QHZR9DZ> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U7QHZR9DZ/FAV4CE7FD/creating_hubdb_table_via_api__with__columns__then_modifying_afterwards__succeeds.sh|Creating HubDB Table via API *with* columns, then modifying afterwards, succeeds>
Looks like a bug, weâ€™ll fix. Thanks for reporting
:thumbsup: thanks for checking in
This has been reported before. I am looking at fixing soon
